ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • MovePilot
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends MovePilot
    A simple custom navigation class that can direct the robot to travel to an x and y (cm) and turn to any angle heading, positive or negative angle. Forward should be 90 degrees, and right is 0 degrees.

    See sections 1.0, 3.0, 3.3 and 4.0 from the "Software Documentation Final document to see how the class is used. See sections 6.1 and 6.2 from the same document to see the algorithms to be implemented.

    Author:
    Ryan Au auryan898@gmail.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigation(Chassis chassis)
      Creates a Navigation instance which is a subclass of the lejos MovePilot, and contains a reference to the lejos OdometryPoseProvider.

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(Chassis chassis)

        Parameters:
        chassis - a lejos chassis that controls the wheels as a single unit

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y,
            boolean immediateReturn)
        This method causes the robot to travel to the absolute field location (x, y), specified in tile points. This method should continuously call turnTo and then set the motor speed to forward (straight). This will make sure that your heading is updated until you reach your exact goal.

        If immediateReturn is true, then this method returns immediately, running its actions concurrently through the existing thread(s) which control the motors. If false, this method will return only when it has completed its commands and stopped moving.

        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        immediateReturn - if true the method will return immediately, and block if false

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y)
        This method causes the robot to travel to the absolute field location (x, y), specified in tile points. This method should continuously call turnTo and then set the motor speed to forward (straight). This will make sure that your heading is updated until you reach your exact goal.

        immediateReturn is false by default.

        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate

      • angleToPoint

        public static double angleToPoint(double x0,
                  double y0,
                  double x1,
                  double y1)
        Helper method that computes the angle in degrees from one point (x0,y0) to another point (x1,y1).
        Parameters:
        x0 - the x-coordinate of the first point
        y0 - the y-coordinate of the first point
        x1 - the x-coordinate of the second point
        y1 - the y-coordinate of the second point
        Returns:
        the angle in degrees

      • distanceToPoint

        public static double distanceToPoint(double x0,
                     double y0,
                     double x1,
                     double y1)
        Helper method that computes the distance from one point (x0,y0) to another point (x1,y1).
        Parameters:
        x0 - the x-coordinate of the first point
        y0 - the y-coordinate of the first point
        x1 - the x-coordinate of the second point
        y1 - the y-coordinate of the second point
        Returns:
        the distance between the points

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta,
          boolean immediateReturn)
        This method causes the robot to turn (on point) to the absolute heading theta. This method should turn the MINIMAL angle to its target.

        If immediateReturn is true, then this method returns immediately, running its actions concurrently through the existing thread(s) which control the motors. If false, this method will return only when it has completed its commands and stopped moving.

        Parameters:
        theta - the heading to turn to, 0 degrees is East

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        This method causes the robot to turn (on point) to the absolute heading theta. This method should turn the MINIMAL angle to its target.

        immediateReturn is false by default.

        Parameters:
        theta - the heading to turn to, 0 degrees is East

      • minimumAngleToHeading

        public static float minimumAngleToHeading(float targetHeading,
                          float currHeading)
        Determines the smallest angle between a current heading, and the target heading. The result is either negative or positive, where positive is counter-clockwise.
        Parameters:
        targetHeading - the current heading in degrees
        currHeading - the target heading in degrees
        Returns:
        the smallest angle needed to turn from the current heading to the target

      • setPose

        public void setPose(Pose pose)
        Assigns a pose to the robot, where it assumes it is in the Cartesian plane. Units should be in centimeters as is consistent with this code base. A lejos Pose object contains the x and y coordinates of the robot, and its heading with respect to the y-axis.
        Parameters:
        pose - a lejos Pose object containing x, y, and theta

      • setPose

        public void setPose(float x,
           float y,
           float heading)
        Assigns a pose to the robot, where it assumes it is in the Cartesian plane. Units should be in centimeters as is consistent with this code base. Stores the x and y coordinates of the robot, and its heading in degrees with respect to the y-axis.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate in centimeters
        y - the y-coordinate in centimeters
        heading - the heading in degrees

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(float x,
               float y)
        Assigns a new x and y coordinate to the robot while preserving the heading.
        Parameters:
        x - the new x-coordinate in centimeters
        y - the new y-coordinate in centimeters

      • setHeading

        public void setHeading(float theta)
        Assigns a new heading to the robot while preserving the x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        theta - the new heading in degrees

      • getPose

        public Pose getPose()
        Retrieves the Pose of the robot, which contains the x, y, and heading values of the robot, in centimeters and degrees respectively.
        Returns:
        a Pose object

        public OdometryPoseProvider getOdometry()

        Returns:
        the odometry controller which maintains position and heading

      • absoluteHeading

        public static float absoluteHeading(float heading)
        Ensures the heading is [0,360) degrees instead of [-180,180]. It will work even if input is 0-360.
        Returns:
        the heading in the specified format

      • negativeHeading

        public static float negativeHeading(float heading)
        Ensures the heading is between (-180,180], instead of [0,360).
